memberdef.argsstring: (const char *program, uint32_t pid, const char *file, char **error)
memberdef.name: basic_init

briefdescription.para: Initialize the BASIC context with the provided program, console, process ID, and file.

parameterdescription.para: The console to use for input/output.
Pointer to store any error messages.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the initialized basic_ctx context.

briefdescription.para: Loads a library by appending it to the end of a running program This will cause many pointers in the context to become invalid, so the library_statement() function will regenerate them. Do not rely on copies of any ptrs inside ctx from before this call!

detaileddescription.para: Handle the LIBRARY statement, which loads a library into the program.

briefdescription.para: Clone an existing BASIC context to create a new one.

simplesect.para: A new basic_ctx that is a clone of the original.

briefdescription.para: Destroy the BASIC context and free associated resources.
Check if the expected token is the current token in the BASIC program.

simplesect.para: True if the token matches, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Jump to a specific line number in the BASIC program.

parameterdescription.para: The line number to jump to.

simplesect.para: True if the jump was successful, false if the line doesn't exist.

briefdescription.para: Free variables held on the local call stack.

detaileddescription.para: Free the local call stack and associated variables for the current function or procedure.
Initialize the local call stack for the current function or procedure.

briefdescription.para: Checks if the program is currently inside an EVAL statement.

detaileddescription.para: This function checks whether the program is inside an EVAL block, which modifies the program at runtime.

simplesect.para: bool True if the program is inside an EVAL, false otherwise.

inbodydescription.para: An EVAL jumps to the line number at the end of the program (EVAL_LINE) where the evaluation is to take place. Once compeleted, a RETURN statement is executed at EVAL_END_LINE, which returns back to the line where the EVAL statement is.

briefdescription.para: Run the BASIC program by executing the next statement.
Check if the BASIC program has finished executing.

simplesect.para: True if the program has finished, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Main functions for BASIC interpreter, context creation, destruction and cloning.

detaileddescription.para: Retro Rocket OS Project (C) Craig Edwards 2012. loosely based on uBASIC (Copyright (c) 2006, Adam Dunkels, All rights reserved).
